intro: Angelica shikokiana, commonly known as the Shikoku angelica, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
